meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of mob rule or government by the masses.
meanings.sent1: The ochlocratical behavior of the unruly crowd caused chaos in the streets.
meanings.sent2: The protest turned ochlocratical as the mob grew more aggressive.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show took an unexpected turn when the audience became ochlocratical during the performance.
meanings.sent4: The power of social media can sometimes lead to an ochlocratical influence on public opinion.
meanings.sent5: The history books are filled with tales of ochlocratical uprisings that changed the course of nations.

meanings.definition: Involving or influenced by a disorderly crowd or mob.
meanings.sent1: The street festival turned ochlocratical when the parade got out of control.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was interrupted by an ochlocratical group of protesters.
meanings.sent3: The school cafeteria became ochlocratical when the food fight broke out.
meanings.sent4: The concert descended into an ochlocratical frenzy as the fans rushed the stage.
meanings.sent5: The movie depicted an ochlocratical scene where the rioters clashed with the police.
